question.body: What percent of cardiac output filters through the kidney every minute?

response.feedback: Incorrect. With this small of a fraction of the blood it would take too long to filter all of the blood.
Incorrect. With this small of a fraction of the blood it would take too long to filter all of the blood.
Correct. The right and left renal arteries transport about one fourth of total cardiac output (approximately 1.2 quarts or 1 liter) to these organs every minute.
Incorrect. This would require that all blood through the body be directly shunted to the kidney.

part.hint: Consider overall blood flow through the body.
